stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on Course 11/13, the Ice-Castle area, debugging a factory lighting bug, and prototyping a new “Freezie” enemy while discussing wider design decisions and project scope.

development_findings.summary: Course 11’s geometry is basically finished; Kaze demonstrates a new ‘spline light’ system and camera that follows moving platforms without clipping.
development_findings.quote: I invented the spline light… look at this, the dots move depending on how the platform moves – that was Biobak’s idea.

development_findings.summary: A secret factory room effect (room darkens after talking to NPC) is broken; Kaze plans to fix it off-stream.
development_findings.quote: You’re supposed to talk to him and the whole room gets darker… the effect is missing, this really sucks.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is building the Freezie enemy: it inhales snow (pulls Mario), then exhales ice shards that freeze Mario; he’s coding particles, hitboxes, and a freeze state that locks Mario’s animation.
development_findings.quote: He should also get bigger if we do this… the Freezie will freeze you if the breath hits you.

development_findings.summary: Physics tweak under consideration: limit the ground-pound dive’s angle change (~30°) to stop it trivialising level design while retaining its ‘feel’.
development_findings.quote: Through the dive you’re making a lot of level design trivial… maybe you can’t change your angle any more.

development_findings.summary: Star/mission plan: 130 core stars plus overworld, Yoshi comet-style challenges, and possibly Sonic-Adventure-style emerald hunts, totalling ~180 stars; only four 100-coin stars are planned.
development_findings.quote: Looks like it’s going to be 180 stars… every content star in this game is like three times the size of a Mario 64 star.

development_findings.summary: Performance/engine notes: F3DX outperforms F3D; dormant UI elements cost ~0.1 µs; Kaze has a one-button ROM upload to real N64 hardware.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina expect their daughter in four weeks; nursery is ready; the baby will be named Reyna after Zeina’s late childhood friend.
context_findings.quote: My daughter will be born in four weeks… she’ll be named Reyna, after a friend of mine that passed away.

context_findings.summary: Kaze will take parental leave and stream more; bonus streams likely for the ‘cumshake’ channel-point redemption.
context_findings.quote: I am going to have more time off next week because of parental leave… what if I just do a bonus stream and we do the cumshake.

context_findings.summary: Kaze distrusts potential Nintendo contact, fearing legal retaliation, and notes 70 of his videos were struck.
context_findings.quote: If Nintendo ever sent me a job offer I’d think it’s a ploy to get me arrested.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes video editing and plans to hire an editor at $16/minute to increase YouTube output.
context_findings.quote: My YouTube output is hard-bottlenecked by my unwillingness to make videos… someone offered $16 per minute, I’m probably taking that.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on difficulty: prefers ‘pick your own risk’ design over formal difficulty modes; considers casual accessibility tweaks but wants elegant solutions.

biobak.summary: Proposed moving light dots on platforms, speed-line UI effect, and suggested leaf-pile particle optimization.
biobak.quote: You see how the dots move depending on how the platform moves – that was Biobak’s idea.

zeina.summary: Explained the origin of the baby’s name on stream and briefly joined voice chat.
zeina.quote: Reyna is named after a friend of mine that passed away when I was 12.

key_stories.title: Naming Reyna
key_stories.summary: During a brief voice call Zeina shares that their unborn daughter will be named Reyna in honor of a childhood friend who died at age 12.
key_stories.process: Zeina explains personal back-story; Kaze shows nursery and jokes about gamer parents.
key_stories.outcome: Name and nursery finalized; custom ‘Z’ and ‘R’ caps planned.
key_stories.key_quote: She’s named after a friend of mine that passed away when I was 12 years old.

key_stories.title: Dive Nerf Debate
key_stories.summary: Another designer convinced Kaze the dive makes levels too forgiving. Kaze experiments with limiting mid-air steering.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing advanced movement vs. level integrity
key_stories.process: Kaze prototypes reduced steering (≈30°) and seeks chat feedback.
key_stories.outcome: No final decision yet; test build in progress.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe a better way is you can’t really change your angle with it anymore.

key_stories.title: Spline-Light Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze shows a dynamic ‘spline light’ that travels with moving platforms, drastically improving atmosphere in the oil factory.
key_stories.challenge: Adding dynamic lighting within N64 limits
key_stories.process: Implemented light following a spline; Biobak suggested moving dots.
key_stories.outcome: System works; camera issues remain but hole in geometry will fix it.
key_stories.key_quote: Isn’t that sick? Light coming from the spline here.

key_stories.title: Freezie Enemy Prototype
key_stories.summary: Kaze live-codes the Ice Castle’s Freezie: sucking particles, cylinder hitbox, freeze state.
key_stories.challenge: Creating convincing inhale/exhale mechanic under hardware limits
key_stories.process: Adjusts particle systems, animation locking, and hitboxes.
key_stories.outcome: Visuals working; freezing Mario and ice block VFX still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: It kind of reminds me of the Snifits… the Freezie will freeze you if the breath hits you.

open_questions.context: Kaze is testing a 30° steering cap but hasn’t committed.
questions: What metrics or feedback will determine whether the dive nerf ships?
How does the team balance veteran tech with newcomer accessibility?

open_questions.context: He floated multiple Yoshi mission types and a Sonic-style emerald hunt but hasn’t settled which stay.
questions: Which extra mission types have been green-lit?
How will you prevent star-value inflation while adding 45 quick stars?

open_questions.context: Kaze joked a Nintendo invite would be a trap.
questions: Have there been any legal contacts from Nintendo?
What safeguards exist if a C&D arrives mid-development?

open_questions.context: A new spline-light system now works in Course 11.
questions: How does the spline light technically work on real N64 hardware?
Could this technique be reused in other levels or future projects?

open_questions.context: Biobak’s art ideas and Zeina’s animation interact with Kaze’s code, but process details are sparse.
questions: What pipelines and tools connect Biobak’s graphics and Zeina’s animations to the decomp codebase?
How are tasks tracked and reviewed among the remote team?

open_questions.context: Kaze plans to pay $16/minute for editing to boost YouTube.
questions: How will outsourcing editing affect development time and finances?
Could behind-the-scenes footage be integrated into the documentary?

open_questions.context: Kaze claims dormant UI costs 0.1 µs and F3DX outperforms F3D.
questions: What are the concrete frame-time budgets per level on real N64?
How is performance profiled and enforced across disciplines?
